Body: Possible Duplicate:  Wrong aspect ration in Desktop background selector  I have a G1.I have background images that fit the resolution of my screen exactly. (320x480)When I try to set them as my background, I can't do it without cropping the image. I want the full image at native resolution as my background. Android wants to use a different image ratio (landscape, while my picture is portrait.)Is there a way to get around this?I only use one home screen because the G1 isn't the sharpest knife in the drawer. So I only want a native resolution background. I don't care if its "scrollable." Can this be done? I also run CyanogenMod 6 if that helps.
Title: Configuring Background Images

history.Text: I have a G1.I have background images that fit the resolution of my screen exactly. (320x480)When I try to set them as my background, I can't do it without cropping the image. I want the full image at native resolution as my background. Android wants to use a different image ratio (landscape, while my picture is portrait.)Is there a way to get around this?I only use one home screen because the G1 isn't the sharpest knife in the drawer. So I only want a native resolution background. I don't care if its "scrollable." Can this be done? I also run CyanogenMod 6 if that helps.

Android wants to use a different image ratio (landscape, while my picture is portrait.)Is there a way to get around this?I only use one home screen because the G1 isn't the sharpest knife in the drawer.
